p: Ribavirin is a guanine analog among approved nucleoside analogs used to treat hepatitis c virus and respiratory syncytial virus infections and has been harnessed to cure patients with SARS [85]. Ribavirin was extensively leveraged for patients with or without concomitant usage of steroids during the SARS outbreak in 2003 [86]. When combined with IFN-Î², it can exert the synergistical inhibition effect on SARS-associated CoV replication in vitro [87]. However, the efficacy and safety of this agent remain uncertain, and it may arouse adverse reactions like anemia in high doses [77]. In COVID-19 therapy, ribavirin was utilized with pegylated interferon for stimulating the innate antiviral reaction at a relatively lower dose to curtail side effects.
